bibl.title: Letter from John H. Walker to H. C. Corbin, January 16, 1903

div1.p: Walker requests a statement of service regarding Reed. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from John H. Walker to H. C. Corbin, January 16, 1903
div1.opener:
Filed with 2959 A.C.P 80 A.J.G.
468586
------
a
A.G.O.
Wash., Jan. 16, 1903.
Senate Committe on Pensions,
Sen. J. H. Gallinger, Chairman.
Request for statement of the
military service of Major Walter
Reed, Surgeon, U. S. A.
✓
Letter & mil hist to Com. Jan 22., 1903
H.G.S.
✓
file
H.G.S.
Addl
ESN 464774
468586 1/17
Received
A. G. O.
M.&R.D.
JAN [unclear]
Recorded A.G.O. Jan 19/03
FIFTY-SEVENTH CONGRESS.
----
JACOB H. CALLINGER, N.H., CHAIRMAN.
JETER C. PRITCHARD. N.C.
WILLIAM J. DEHOE, KY.
PORTER J. MCCUMBER, N. DAK.
JOSEPH SIMON, ORE.
NATHAN B. SCOTT, W.VA.
ADDISON G. FOSTER, WASH.
JOSEPH R. DURTON, KANS.
GEORGE TURNER, WASH.
JAMES P. TALIAFERRO, FLA.
THOMAS M. PATTERSON, COLO.
EDWARD W. CARMACK, TENN.
PARIS GIBSON, MONT.
JOHN H. WALKER, CLERK.
UNITED STATES SENATE.
COMMITTEE ON PENSIONS,
WASHINGTON.
Jan. 16, 1903.
Sir:-
div1.p:
I am directed by Senator Gallinger to respectfully re-
quest that you furnish for use of this Committee in connection
with Senate Bill 6702 a statement of the service of Walter Reed,
late major and surgeon United States Army, who died in this city
November 23, 1902.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, John H. Walker Clerk.
Major General H. C. Corbin,
Adjutant-General, U. S. A.
